titles.title: Terrorist Victims Flag Memorial Resolution of 2001
Terrorist Victims Flag Memorial Resolution of 2001
Providing Capitol-flown flags to each surviving victim, and the family of each deceased victim, of the terrorist attacks which occurred on September 11, 2001.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on House Administration.
Mr. Ney asked unanimous consent to discharge from committee and consider.

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to without objection.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 9/15/2001--Passed House without amendment. Terrorist Victims Flag Memorial Resolution of 2001 - Authorizes, at the request of a surviving victim or the family of a deceased victim of the terrorist attacks on September 11, 2001, the Representative of such victim or family to provide a Capitol-flown flag, not to exceed one flag per victim or family, together with a specified certificate signed by the Speaker of the House of Representatives and the Representative providing the flag.
